tag.description: Tag attached to an object - has a type and value

annotations.description: Dictionary of arbitrary (key, value) on a resource.

display_name.description: Display name user configured string(name) that can be updated any time. Used as openstack name.

id_perms.description: System maintained identity, time  and permissions data.

perms2.description: Permissions data for role based access.

uuid.description: UUID of the object, system automatically allocates one if not provided

security_group.description: port access control list is  automatically derived from all the security groups attached to port.

virtual_network.description: Virtual network access control list are automatically derived from all the network policies attached to virtual network.

access_control_list_entries.description: Automatically generated by system based on security groups or network policies.

access_control_list_hash.description: A hash value of all the access-control-list-entries in this ACL objects automatically generated by system.

project.description: Project level address Group object

global_system_config.description: List of alarms that are applicable to objects anchored under global-system-config.

project.description: List of alarms that are applicable to objects anchored under the project.

alarm_rules.description: Rules based on the UVE attributes specified as OR-of-ANDs of AlarmExpression template. Example: "alarm_rules": {"or_list": [{"and_list": [{AlarmExpression1}, {AlarmExpression2}, ...]}, {"and_list": [{AlarmExpression3}, {AlarmExpression4}, ...]}]}

uve_keys.description: List of UVE tables or UVE objects where this alarm config should be applied. For example, rules based on NodeStatus UVE can be applied to multiple object types or specific uve objects such as analytics-node, config-node, control-node:<hostname>, etc.,

virtual_network.description: Alias ip pool is set of addresses that are carved out of a given network. Ip(s) from this set can be assigned to virtual-machine-interface so that they become members of this network

alias_ip_pool.description: alias ip is a ip that can be assigned to virtual-machine-interface(VMI), By doing so VMI can now be part of the alias ip network. packets originating with alias-ip as the source-ip belongs to alias-ip-network

project.description: Reference to project from which this alias ip was allocated.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to virtual machine interface to which this alias ip is attached.

alias_ip_address_family.description: Ip address family of the alias ip, IpV4 or IpV6

global_system_config.description: Analytics node is object representing a logical node in system which serves operational API and analytics collector.

analytics_node_ip_address.description: Ip address of the analytics node, set while provisioning.

domain.description: API access list is list of rules that define role based access to each API and its properties at domain level.

global_system_config.description: Global API access list applicable to all domain and projects

project.description: API access list is list of rules that define role based access to each API and its properties at project level.

api_access_list_entries.description: List of rules e.g network.* => admin:CRUD (admin can perform all ops on networks).

policy_management.description: Application-policy object defining policies to apply for a given application tag

project.description: Project level application-policy object defining policies to apply for a given application tag

firewall_policy.description: Reference to firewall-policy attached to this application-policy

global_vrouter_config.description: Reference to global-vrouter-config is automatically created by system for global           application policy sets

all_applications.description: If set, indicates application policy set to be applied to all application tags

project.description: BGP as service object represents BGP peer in the virtual network that can participate in dynamic routing with implicit default gateway of the virtual network.

service_health_check.description: Reference to health check object attached to BGPaaS object, used to enable BFD health check over active BGPaaS VMI.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to VMI on which BGPaaS BGP peering will happen.

autonomous_system.description: 16 bit BGP Autonomous System number for the cluster.

bgpaas_ip_address.description: Ip address of the BGP peer.

bgpaas_ipv4_mapped_ipv6_nexthop.description: True when client bgp implementation expects to receive a ipv4-mapped ipv6 address (as opposed to regular ipv6 address) as the bgp nexthop for ipv6 routes.

bgpaas_shared.description: True if only one BGP router needs to be created. Otherwise, one BGP router is created for each VMI

bgpaas_suppress_route_advertisement.description: True when server should not advertise any routes to the client i.e. the client has static routes (typically a default) configured.

project.description: BGP VPN resource contains a set of parameters for a BGP-based VPN

bgpvpn_type.description: BGP VPN type selection between IP VPN (l3) and Ethernet VPN (l2) (default: l3).

export_route_target_list.description: List of route targets that are used as export for this virtual network.

import_route_target_list.description: List of route targets that are used as import for this virtual network.

route_target_list.description: List of route targets that are used as both import and export for this virtual network.

virtual_network.description: bridge-domains configured in a virtual network

mac_aging_time.description: MAC aging time on the network

mac_learning_enabled.description: Enable MAC learning on the network

mac_limit_control.description: MAC limit control on the network

mac_move_control.description: MAC move control on the network

global_system_config.description: Config node is object representing a logical node in system which serves config API.

config_node_ip_address.description: Ip address of the config node, set while provisioning.

tag.description: Attribute attached to objects - has a type and value

global_system_config.description: Database node is object representing a logical node in system which host Cassandra DB and Zookeeper.

database_node_ip_address.description: Ip address of the database node, set while provisioning.

config_root.description: Domain is authentication namespace, a collection of projects.

domain_limits.description: Domain level quota, not currently implemented

discovery_service_assignment.description: Discovery service rule for assigning subscriber to publisher. (set of subscriber) can be assigned to (set of publisher).

dsa_rule_entry.description: rule entry defining publisher set and subscriber set.

peering_policy.description: Links the service provider to a peering policy.

physical_router.description: Links the service provider to peer routers.

e2_service_provider_promiscuous.description: This service provider is connected to all other service providers.

policy_management.description: firewall-policy object consisting of one or more firewall rules

project.description: Project level firewall-policy object consisting of one or more firewall rules

firewall_rule.description: Reference to firewall-rule attached to this firewall-policy

security_logging_object.description: Reference to security-logging-object attached to this firewall-policy

project.description: Project level firewall-rule object

address_group.description: Reference to address group attached to endpoints

security_logging_object.description: Reference to security-logging-object attached to this firewall-rule

service_group.description: Reference to service-group attached to this firewall policy

virtual_network.description: Reference to virtual network attached to endpoints

action_list.description: Actions to be performed if packets match condition

match_tag_types.description: matching tags ids for source and destination endpoints

match_tags.description: matching tags for source and destination endpoints

service.description: Service (port, protocol) for packets match condition

virtual_network.description: Floating ip pool is set of ip address that are carved out of a given network. Ip(s) from this set can be assigned to (virtual machine interface, ip) so that they become members of this network using one:one NAT.

floating_ip_pool_subnets.description: Subnets that restrict floating ip allocation from the corresponding virtual network.

floating_ip_pool.description: Floating ip is a ip that can be assigned to (virtual machine interface(VMI), ip), By doing so VMI can no be part of the floating ip network and floating ip is used as one:one to NAT for doing so.

instance_ip.description: floating-ip can be child of instance-ip. By doing so instance-ip can be used as floating-ip.

project.description: Reference to project is which this floating ip was allocated.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to virtual machine interface to which this floating ip is attached.

floating_ip_address_family.description: Ip address family of the floating ip, IpV4 or IpV6

floating_ip_fixed_ip_address.description: This floating is tracking given fixed ip of the interface. The given fixed ip is used in 1:1 NAT.

floating_ip_is_virtual_ip.description: This floating ip is used as virtual ip (VIP) in case of LBaaS.

floating_ip_port_mappings.description: List of PortMaps for this floating-ip.

floating_ip_port_mappings_enable.description: If it is false, floating-ip Nat is done for all Ports. If it is true, floating-ip Nat is done to the list of PortMaps.

floating_ip_traffic_direction.description: Specifies direction of traffic for the floating-ip

qos_queue.description: Qos queue to be used for this forwarding class.

forwarding_class_dscp.description: DSCP value to be written on outgoing packet for this forwarding-class.

forwarding_class_id.description: Unique ID for this forwarding class.

forwarding_class_mpls_exp.description: MPLS exp value to be written on outgoing packet for this forwarding-class.

forwarding_class_vlan_priority.description: 802.1p value to be written on outgoing packet for this forwarding-class.

global_system_config.description: Global QoS system config is object where all global system QoS configuration is present.

control_traffic_dscp.description: DSCP value of IP header for control traffic

config_root.description: Global system config is object where all global system configuration is present.

bgp_router.description: List of references to all bgp routers in systems.

alarm_enable.description: Flag to enable/disable alarms configured under global-system-config. True, if not set.

autonomous_system.description: 16 bit BGP Autonomous System number for the cluster.

bgp_always_compare_med.description: Always compare MED even if paths are received from different ASes.

bgpaas_parameters.description: BGP As A Service Parameters configuration

config_version.description: Version of OpenContrail software that generated this config.

ibgp_auto_mesh.description: When true, system will automatically create BGP peering mesh with all control-nodes that have same BGP AS number as global AS number.

ip_fabric_subnets.description: List of all subnets in which vrouter ip address exist. Used by Device manager to configure dynamic GRE tunnels on the SDN gateway.

mac_aging_time.description: MAC aging time on the network

mac_limit_control.description: MAC limit control on the network

mac_move_control.description: MAC move control on the network

plugin_tuning.description: Various Orchestration system plugin(interface) parameters, like Openstack Neutron plugin.

global_system_config.description: Global vrouter config is object where all global vrouter config is present.

ecmp_hashing_include_fields.description: ECMP hashing config at global level.

enable_security_logging.description: Enable or disable security-logging in the system

encapsulation_priorities.description: Ordered list of encapsulations that vrouter will use in priority order.

flow_aging_timeout_list.description: Flow aging timeout per application (protocol, port) list.

flow_export_rate.description: Flow export rate is global config, rate at which each vrouter will sample and export flow records to analytics

forwarding_mode.description: Packet forwarding mode for this system L2-only, L3-only OR L2-L3. L2-L3 is default.

linklocal_services.description: Global services provided on link local subnet to the virtual machines.

network_ipam.description: Reference to network ipam of this instance ip.

physical_router.description: This instance ip is used as IRB address on the referenced physical router (e.g.MX), In case of OVSDB TOR usecase this address will be used as default gateway for Host behind the TOR.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to virtual machine interface to which this instance ip is attached.

virtual_network.description: Reference to virtual network of this instance ip.

virtual_router.description: Reference to virtual router of this instance ip.

instance_ip_address.description: Ip address value for instance ip.

instance_ip_family.description: Ip address family for instance ip, IPv4(v4) or IPv6(v6).

instance_ip_local_ip.description: This instance ip is local to compute and will not be exported to other nodes.

instance_ip_mode.description: Ip address HA mode in case this instance ip is used in more than one interface, active-Active or active-Standby.

instance_ip_secondary.description: This instance ip is secondary ip of the interface.

secondary_ip_tracking_ip.description: When this instance ip is secondary ip, it can track activeness of another ip.

service_health_check_ip.description: This instance ip is used as service health check source ip

service_instance_ip.description: This instance ip is used as service chain next hop

subnet_uuid.description: This instance ip was allocated from this Subnet(UUID).

project.description: Interface route table is mechanism to add static routes pointing to this interface.

service_instance.description: Reference to interface route table attached to (service instance, interface), This is used to add interface static routes to service instance interface.

interface_route_table_routes.description: Interface route table used same structure as route table, however the next hop field is irrelevant.

project.description: Health monitor objects is configuration to monitor health of individual pool members.

loadbalancer_healthmonitor_properties.description: Configuration parameters for health monitor like type, method, retries etc.

project.description: Listener represents the application(protocol, port) to be load balanced.

loadbalancer_pool.description: Configuration object representing each member of load balancer pool.

loadbalancer_member_properties.description: Member configuration like ip address, destination port, weight etc.

project.description: Loadbalancer pool object represent set(pool) member servers which needs load balancing.

loadbalancer_healthmonitor.description: Reference to loadbalancer healthmonitor that this pool uses.

loadbalancer_listener.description: Reference to loadbalancer listener served by this pool, applicable to LBaaS V2.

service_appliance_set.operation: RReference to service-appliance-set where this loadbalancer-pool is hosted. Applicable to LBaaS V1.

service_instance.description: Reference to the service instance serving this pool, applicable to LBaaS V1.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to the virtual machine interface reaching pool subnet, applicable to LBaaS V1.

loadbalancer_pool_custom_attributes.description: Custom loadbalancer config, opaque to the system. Specified as list of Key:Value pairs. Applicable to LBaaS V1.

loadbalancer_pool_properties.description: Configuration for loadbalancer pool like protocol, subnet, etc.

loadbalancer_pool_provider.description: Provider field selects backend provider of the LBaaS, Cloudadmin could offer different levels of service like gold, silver, bronze. Provided by  HA-proxy or various HW or SW appliances in the backend. Applicable to LBaaS V1

project.description: Loadbalancer object represents a LBaaS instance. One single Virtual IP and multiple (listeners, pools). Applicable to LBaaS V2.

service_instance.description: Reference to the service instance, created automatically by the system.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to the virtual machine interface for VIP, created automatically by the system.

loadbalancer_properties.description: Loadbalancer configuration like  admin state, VIP, VIP subnet etc.

loadbalancer_provider.description: Provider field selects backend provider of the LBaaS, Cloudadmin could offer different levels of service like gold, silver, bronze. Provided by  HA-proxy or various HW or SW appliances in the backend.

physical_interface.description: Logical interfaces on physical interface on physical routers.

virtual_machine_interface.description: References to virtual machine interfaces that represent end points that are reachable by this logical interface.

logical_interface_vlan_tag.description: VLAN tag (.1Q) classifier for this logical interface.

project.description: Logical router is a mechanism to connect multiple virtual network as they have been connected by a router.

bgpvpn.description: Back reference to logical router associated to the BGP VPN resource

physical_router.description: Reference to physical router, when this link is present device manager configures logical router associated route targets/interfaces on the Physical Router.

route_table.description: Reference to the route table attached to this logical router. By attaching route table, system will create static routes with the route target only of route targets linked to this logical router

route_target.description: Route target that represent this logical router.

service_instance.description: Reference to service instance doing SNAT functionality for external gateway.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to the interface attached to this logical router. By attaching a interface to logical network all subnets in the virtual network of the interface has this router.

virtual_network.description: Reference to virtual network used as external gateway for this logical network. This link will cause a SNAT being spawned between all networks connected to logical router and external network.

configured_route_target_list.description: List of route targets that represent this logical router, all virtual networks connected to this logical router will have this as their route target list.

vxlan_network_identifier.description: The VNI that needs to be associated with the internal VN if vxlan_routing mode is enabled.

domain.description: Namespace is unique networking namespace within this domain. If namespace is not present then default namespace of default project is used.

namespace_cidr.description: All networks in this namespace belong to this list of Prefixes. Not implemented.

physical_router.description: Network device config of a physical router.

project.description: IP Address Management object that controls, ip allocation, DNS and DHCP

virtual_DNS.description: Reference to virtual DNS used by this IPAM.

ipam_subnet_method.description: Subnet method configuration for ipam, user can configure user-defined, flat or auto.

ipam_subnets.description: List of subnets for this ipam.

project.description: Network Policy is set access control rules that can be attached to virtual networks. Network ACL(s) and connectivity information is derived from Network policies that are attached to virtual networks.

physical_interface.description: Reference to the other physical interface that is connected to this  physical interface.

ethernet_segment_identifier.description: Ethernet Segment Id configured for the Physical Interface. In a multihomed environment, user should configure the peer Physical interface with the same ESI.

global_system_config.description: Physical router object represent any physical device that participates in virtual networking, like routers, switches, servers, firewalls etc.

bgp_router.description: Reference to BGP peer representing this physical router.

virtual_network.description: Reference to virtual network, whose VRF is present on this physical router, Applicable when only VRF is present with no physical interfaces from this physical vrouter. Generally used when using device manager and option A+B for this virtual network in L3VPN use case.

virtual_router.description: Reference to vrouter responsible for this physical router. Currently only applicable for vrouters that are TOR agents.

physical_router_dataplane_ip.description: This is ip address in the ip-fabric(underlay) network that can be used in data plane by physical router. Usually it is the VTEP address in VxLAN for the TOR switch.

physical_router_junos_service_ports.description: Juniper JUNOS specific service interfaces name  to perform services like NAT.

physical_router_loopback_ip.description: This is ip address of loopback interface of physical router. Used by the device manager to configure physical router loopback interface.

physical_router_management_ip.description: Management ip for this physical router. It is used by the device manager to perform netconf and by SNMP collector if enabled.

physical_router_product_name.description: Model name of the physical router (e.g juniper). Used by the device manager to select driver.

physical_router_role.description: Physical router role (e.g spine or leaf), used by the device manager to provision physical router, for e.g device manager may choose to configure physical router based on its role.

physical_router_snmp_credentials.description: SNMP credentials for the physical router used by SNMP collector.

physical_router_user_credentials.description: Username and password for netconf to the physical router by device manager.

physical_router_vendor_name.description: Vendor name of the physical router (e.g juniper). Used by the device manager to select driver.

physical_router_vnc_managed.description: This physical router is enabled to be configured by device manager.

telemetry_info.description: Telemetry info of router. Check TelemetryStateInfo

domain.description: Project represent one instance of application or tenant.

alias_ip_pool.description: Reference to alias ip pool in this project.

application_policy_set.description: Reference to default application-policy-set is automatically createdby system for default socped application policy sets. Needed by vrouter to identify default application-policy-set rules of a virtual machine interface

floating_ip_pool.description: Reference to floating ip pool in this project.

namespace.description: Reference to network namespace of this project.

alarm_enable.description: Flag to enable/disable alarms configured under global-system-config. True, if not set.

quota.description: Max instances limits for various objects under project.

vxlan_routing.description: When this knob is enabled for a project, an internal system VN (VN-Int) is created for every logical router in the project.

global_qos_config.description: Global system QoS config for vhost and fabric traffic .

project.operation: CRUDQOS configuration specifying marking and queuing value for various QoS values

global_system_config.description: This link is internally created and may be removed in future. End users should not set this link or assume it to be there

default_forwarding_class_id.description: Default forwarding class used for all non-specified QOS bits

dscp_entries.description: Map of DSCP match condition and applicable forwarding class for packet.

mpls_exp_entries.description: Map of MPLS EXP values to applicable forwarding class for packet.

qos_config_type.description: Specifies if qos-config is for vhost, fabric or for project.

vlan_priority_entries.description: Map of .1p priority code to applicable forwarding class for packet.

global_qos_config.description: QOS queue config object in this project.

project.description: List of references of child routing route aggregate objects. automatically maintained by system.

service_instance.description: Reference to route-aggregate policy attached to (service instance, interface).

project.description: Network route table is mechanism of adding static routes in the virtual network

routes.description: Routes in the route table are configured in following way.

virtual_network.description: List of references of routing instances for this virtual network, routing instances are internal to the system.

project.description: List of references of child routing policy objects. automatically maintained by system.

service_instance.description: Reference to routing policy attached to (service instance, interface).

project.description: Security Groups are set of state full access control rules attached to interfaces.It can be used to implement microsegmentation.

configured_security_group_id.description: Unique 32 bit user defined ID assigned to this security group [1, 8M - 1].

security_group_id.description: Unique 32 bit ID automatically assigned to this security group [8M+1, 32G].

global_vrouter_config.description: Reference to security logging object for global-vrouter-config.

project.description: Security logging object configuration for specifying session logging criteria

network_policy.description: Reference to network-policy attached to this security-logging-object

rule.description: List of rules along with logging rate for each rule. Both rule-uuid and rate are optional. When rule-uuid is absent then it means all rules of associated SG or network-policy

security_group.description: Reference to security-group attached to this security-logging-object

rule.description: List of rules along with logging rate for each rule. Both rule-uuid and rate are optional. When rule-uuid is absent then it means all rules of associated SG or network-policy

security_logging_object_rate.description: Security logging object rate defining rate of session logging

security_logging_object_rules.description: Security logging object rules derived internally.

service_appliance_set.description: Service appliance is a member in service appliance set (e.g. Loadbalancer, Firewall provider).By default system will create "ha-proxy" based service appliance.

physical_interface.description: Reference to physical interface that can be used as (service interface type)left, right, management OR other.

service_appliance_ip_address.description: Management Ip address of the service-appliance.

service_appliance_properties.description: List of Key:Value pairs used by the provider driver of this service appliance.

service_appliance_user_credentials.description: Authentication credentials for driver to access service appliance.

service_appliance_driver.description: Name of the provider driver for this service appliance set.

service_appliance_ha_mode.description: High availability mode for the service appliance set, active-active or active-backup.

service_appliance_set_properties.description: List of Key:Value pairs that are used by the provider driver and opaque to system.

service_object.description: Links the service-connection-module to a service object.

service_type.description: Type of service assigned for this object

physical_router.description: Reference to Router for a given service.

service_connection_module.description: Link the service endpoint to service connection node

service_object.description: Links the service-endpoints to a service object.

project.description: Project level service Group object

service_group_firewall_service_list.description: list of service objects (protocol, source port and destination port

project.description: Service health check is a keepalive mechanism for the virtual machine interface. Liveliness of the interface is determined based on configuration in the service health check. It is mainly designed for service instance interfaces. However it will work with any interface which present on contrail vrouter.

service_instance.description: Reference to service instance using this service health check.

service_health_check_properties.description: Service health check has following fields.

project.description: Service instance represents logical instance service used in the virtual world, e.g. firewall, load balancer etc. It can represent one or multiple virtual machines or physical devices. Many service instances can share a virtual machine or physical device.

instance_ip.description: Reference to ip address, which is used as nexthop pointing to (service instance, service interface).

service_template.description: Reference to the service template of this service instance.

service_instance_bindings.description: Opaque key value pair for generating config for the service instance.

domain.description: Service template defines how a service may be deployed in the network. Service instance is instantiated from config in service template.

service_appliance_set.description: Reference to the service appliance set represented by this service template.

virtual_machine_interface.description: Subnet belongs of the referenced virtual machine interface. This is used in CPE use case when a subnet is reachable via the interface. It also serves as dynamic DHCP pool for host on this LAN, where vrouter is DHCP server.

config_root.description: Attribute attached to objects - has a type and value

project.description: Attribute attached to objects - has a type and value

tag_type.description: Tag type reference which is limited to one

tag_id.description: Internal Tag ID encapsulating tag type and value in                  hexadecimal fomat: 0xTTTTVVVV (T: type, V: value)

tag_type_id.description: Internal Tag type ID                  coded on 16 bits where the first 255 IDs are reserved                  and pre-defined. Users (principally cloud admin) can define                  arbitrary types but its automatically shared to all project as                  it is a global resource.

project.description: Reference to a project of this user.

password.description: Domain level quota, not currently implemented

virtual_DNS.description: Static DNS records in virtual DNS server.

virtual_DNS_record_data.description: DNS record data has configuration like type, name, ip address, loadbalancing etc.

domain.description: Virtual DNS server is DNS as service for tenants. It is inbound DNS service for virtual machines in this project. DNS requests by end points inside this project/IPAM are served by this DNS server rules.

virtual_DNS_data.description: Virtual DNS data has configuration for virtual DNS like domain, dynamic records etc.

project.description: Virtual ip object application(protocol, port). Applicable only to LBaaS V1

loadbalancer_pool.description: Reference to the load balancer pool that this virtual ip represent. Applicable only to LBaaS V1

virtual_machine_interface.description: Reference to the virtual machine interface for virtual ip. Applicable only to LBaaS V1

virtual_ip_properties.description: Virtual ip configuration like port, protocol, subnet etc.

project.description: Virtual machine interface represent a interface(port) into virtual network. It may or may not have corresponding virtual machine. A virtual machine interface has atleast a MAC address and Ip address.

virtual_machine.description: References to child interfaces this virtual machine has, this is DEPRECATED.

virtual_router.description: An interface on a virtual-router, e.g. vhost0

bgp_router.description: Reference to bgp-router from the virtual machine interface.

bridge_domain.description: Virtual Machine interface maps to a bridge-domain by defaultor based on in coming 802.1Q vlan tag

vlan_tag.description: VLAN tag of the incoming packet that maps the                      virtual-machine-interface to bridge domain

interface_route_table.description: Reference to the interface route table attached to this interface.

physical_interface.description: Reference to the physical interface of service appliance this service interface represents.

qos_config.description: Reference to QoS config for this virtual machine interface.

routing_instance.description: Automatically generated Forwarding policy. This will be deprecated in future in favour of VRF assign rules.

security_group.description: Interface ACL, Automatically generated by system based on security groups attached to this interface.

security_logging_object.description: Reference to security logging object for this virtual machine interface

service_endpoint.description: Links the access endpoint i.e virtual-machine-interface to service endpoint.

service_health_check.description: Reference to health check object attached to this interface.

virtual_machine.description: This interface belongs to the referenced virtual machine.

virtual_machine_interface.description: List of references to the sub interfaces of this interface.

virtual_network.description: This interface is member of the referenced virtual network.

ecmp_hashing_include_fields.description: ECMP hashing config at global level.

port_security_enabled.description: Port security status on the network

virtual_machine_interface_allowed_addres.description: List of (IP address, MAC) other than instance ip on this interface.

virtual_machine_interface_bindings.description: Dictionary of arbitrary (key, value) for this interface. Neutron port bindings use this.

virtual_machine_interface_device_owner.description: For openstack compatibility, not used by system.

virtual_machine_interface_dhcp_option_li.description: DHCP options configuration specific to this interface.

virtual_machine_interface_disable_policy.description: When True all policy checks for ingress and egress traffic from this interface are disabled. Flow table entries are not created. Features that require policy will not work on this interface, these include security group, floating IP, service chain, linklocal services.

virtual_machine_interface_fat_flow_proto.description: List of (protocol, port number), for flows to interface with (protocol, destination port number), vrouter will ignore source port while setting up flow and ignore it as source port in reverse flow. Hence many flows will map to single flow.

virtual_machine_interface_host_routes.description: List of host routes(prefixes, nexthop) that are passed to VM via DHCP.

virtual_machine_interface_mac_addresses.description: MAC address of the virtual machine interface, automatically assigned by system if not provided.

vlan_tag_based_bridge_domain.description: Enable VLAN tag based bridge domain classification on the port

vrf_assign_table.description: VRF assignment policy for this interface, automatically generated by system.

service_instance.description: Reference to the service instance of this virtual machine.

project.description: Virtual network is collection of end points (interface or ip(s) or MAC(s)) that can talk to each other by default. It is collection of subnets connected by implicit router which default gateway in each subnet.

bgpvpn.description: Back reference to virtual network associated to the BGP VPN resource

network_ipam.description: Reference to network-ipam this network is using. It has list of subnets that are being used as property of the reference.

host_routes.description: Common host routes to be sent via DHCP for VM(s) in all the subnets, Next hop for these routes is always default gateway

network_policy.description: Reference to network-policy attached to this network. It has sequence number to specify attachment order.

sequence.description: Sequence number to specify order of policy attachment to network

timer.description: Timer to specify when the policy can be active

qos_config.description: Reference to QoS configuration for this virtual network.

route_table.description: Reference to route table attached to this virtual network.

security_logging_object.description: Reference to security logging object for this virtual network.

virtual_network.description: Reference to a virtual network which is the provider network for the given virtual network. Traffic forwarding happens in the routing instance of the provider network.

address_allocation_mode.description: Address allocation mode for virtual network.

ecmp_hashing_include_fields.description: ECMP hashing config at global level.

export_route_target_list.description: List of route targets that are used as export for this virtual network.

external_ipam.description: IP address assignment to VM is done statically, outside of (external to) Contrail Ipam. vCenter only feature.

flood_unknown_unicast.description: When true, packets with unknown unicast MAC address are flooded within the network. Default they are dropped.

import_route_target_list.description: List of route targets that are used as import for this virtual network.

is_shared.description: When true, this virtual network is shared with all tenants.

layer2_control_word.description: Enable/Disable adding control word to the Layer 2 encapsulation

mac_aging_time.description: MAC aging time on the network

mac_learning_enabled.description: Enable MAC learning on the network

mac_limit_control.description: MAC limit control on the network

mac_move_control.description: MAC move control on the network

pbb_etree_enable.description: Enable/Disable PBB ETREE mode on the network

pbb_evpn_enable.description: Enable/Disable PBB EVPN tunneling on the network

port_security_enabled.description: Port security status on the network

provider_properties.description: Virtual network is provider network. Specifies VLAN tag and physical network name.

route_target_list.description: List of route targets that are used as both import and export for this virtual network.

router_external.description: When true, this virtual network is openstack router external network.

virtual_network_network_id.description: System assigned unique 32 bit ID for every virtual network.

global_system_config.description: Virtual router is packet forwarding system on devices such as compute nodes(servers), TOR(s), routers.

network_ipam.description: Reference to network-ipam this virtual-router is using. It has list of virtual-router specific allocation-pools and cidrs that are being used as property of the reference.

allocation_pools.description: List of ranges of ip address for vrouter specific allocation

subnet.description: List of ip prefix and length for vrouter specific subnets

virtual_machine.description: References to all virtual machines on this vrouter. This link is not present for dynamically scheduled VMs by Nova.

virtual_router_dpdk_enabled.description: This vrouter's data path is using DPDK library, Virtual machines interfaces scheduled on this compute node will be tagged with additional flags so that they are spawned with user space virtio driver. It is only applicable for embedded vrouter.

virtual_router_ip_address.description: Ip address of the virtual router.

virtual_router_type.description: Different types of the vrouters in the system.

config_audit_ttl.title: Configuration Audit Retention Time
config_audit_ttl.description: Configuration Audit Retention Time in hours

flow_ttl.title: Flow Data Retention Time
flow_ttl.description: Flow Data Retention Time in hours

statistics_ttl.title: Statistics Data Retention Time
statistics_ttl.description: Statistics Data Retention Time in hours

capacity_drives.title: Capacity Drives
capacity_drives.description: Drives for capacity oriented applications such as logging

performance_drives.title: Performance Drive
performance_drives.description: Drives for performance oriented application such as journaling

gcp_account_info.title: Account info
gcp_account_info.description: copy and paste contents of account.json

private_ospd_package_url.title: Location of OSPD Contrail Networking Packages

private_ospd_vm_disk_gb.title: OSPD Disk Size in gigabytes
private_ospd_vm_disk_gb.description: disk spae to assign to RH OSPD vm

private_ospd_vm_ram_mb.title: OSPD RAM in megabyts
private_ospd_vm_ram_mb.description: ram to assign to RH OSPD vm

private_ospd_vm_vcpus.title: OSPD vCPUs
private_ospd_vm_vcpus.description: vcpus to assign to RH OSPD vm

private_redhat_subscription_user.title: Redhat Subscription User
private_redhat_subscription_user.description: User name for RedHat subscription account

private_power_management_ip.title: Power Management IP
private_power_management_ip.description: IP address used for power management (IPMI)

default_capacity_drives.title: Default Capacity Drives  for Controller Node Role
default_capacity_drives.description: Drives for capacity oriented applications such as logging for Controller Node Role

default_journal_drives.title: Journal Drives  for Storage Node Role
default_journal_drives.description: SSD Drives to use for journals

default_osd_drives.title: Stoage Drives for Storage Node Role
default_osd_drives.description: Drives to use for cloud storage

default_performance_drives.title: Default Performance Drive  for Controller Node Role
default_performance_drives.description: Drives for performance oriented application such as journaling  for Controller Node Role

default_storage_access_bond_interface_me.title: Default Storage Access  Bond Interface Members

default_storage_backend_bond_interface_m.title: Default Storage Backend Bond Interface Members

external_allocation_pool_end.title: External Allocation pool end
external_allocation_pool_end.description: End of the allocation pool range

external_allocation_pool_start.title: External Allocation pool start
external_allocation_pool_start.description: Start of the allocation pool range

external_net_cidr.title: External Network CIDR
external_net_cidr.description: Subnet to use for external network

journal_drives.title: Journal Drives
journal_drives.description: SSD Drives to use for journals

osd_drives.title: Stoage Drives
osd_drives.description: Drives to use for cloud storage
